meanings.definition: A person or company that sells goods in large quantities to retailers.
meanings.sent1: The wholesalers delivered a huge shipment of products to the store.
meanings.sent2: Retailers buy products in bulk from wholesalers to stock their shelves.
meanings.sent3: The wholesalers joked that they could supply the entire town with just one order.
meanings.sent4: The wholesalers were like the Santa Claus of the retail world, bringing gifts in bulk.
meanings.sent5: The wholesalers' warehouse was filled with rows and rows of products ready to be sold.

meanings.definition: The act of selling goods in large quantities to retailers.
meanings.sent1: The wholesalers' business thrived due to their efficient distribution system.
meanings.sent2: The wholesalers' main focus is on providing products in large quantities to retailers.
meanings.sent3: The wholesalers turned the mundane task of selling into an art form.
meanings.sent4: The wholesalers' sales strategy was like a well-oiled machine, smoothly delivering goods to retailers.
meanings.sent5: The wholesalers' success was built on their ability to meet retailers' demands promptly.
